fields.title: nondeterministic finite automata
fields.summary: Nondeterministic finite automata are a model of computation that generalizes (deterministic) finite automata. Each state is allowed multiple transitions for a given input character, and the automaton accepts the input if there is any legal sequence of transitions which ends in an accepting state. While NFAs appear more powerful than DFAs, the two are provably equivalent in terms of the languages they can represent.
